api/WinFormsApp1.AppCanvas.html.title: Class AppCanvas | ASE Sadikshya Duwadi Comp-2 Documentation
api/WinFormsApp1.AppCanvas.html.keywords: Class AppCanvas Namespace WinFormsApp1 Assembly WinFormsApp1.dll public class AppCanvas : ICanvas Inheritance object AppCanvas Implements ICanvas Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Constructors AppCanvas() Initializes a new instance of the AppCanvas class and sets the canvas size to default. public AppCanvas() Fields errormessage public const string errormessage = "Cannot draw outside of the canvas." Field Value string Properties PenColour Gets or sets the color of the pen used for drawing. public object PenColour { get; set; } Property Value object Xpos Gets or sets the current X position on the canvas. public int Xpos { get; set; } Property Value int Ypos Gets or sets the current Y position on the canvas. public int Ypos { get; set; } Property Value int Methods Circle(int, bool) Draws a circle at the current position with the specified radius. The circle can be either filled or outlined based on the parameter. public void Circle(int radius, bool filled) Parameters radius int The radius of the circle. filled bool Indicates whether the circle should be filled or outlined. Exceptions CanvasException Thrown if the radius is negative. Clear() Clears the entire canvas by filling it with a gray color. public void Clear() DrawTo(int, int) Draws a line from the current position to the specified coordinates. Throws an exception if the destination is outside the canvas boundaries. public void DrawTo(int toX, int toY) Parameters toX int The X-coordinate of the destination point. toY int The Y-coordinate of the destination point. Exceptions CanvasException Thrown if the destination coordinates are outside the canvas boundaries. MoveTo(int, int) Moves the current position to the specified coordinates on the canvas. Throws an exception if the coordinates are outside the canvas boundaries. public void MoveTo(int x, int y) Parameters x int The X-coordinate of the new position. y int The Y-coordinate of the new position. Exceptions CanvasException Thrown if the coordinates are outside the canvas boundaries. Reset() Resets the current position to (0, 0) on the canvas. public void Reset() Set(int, int) Sets the canvas size to the specified dimensions and initializes the graphics object. public void Set(int xsize, int ysize) Parameters xsize int The width of the canvas. ysize int The height of the canvas. SetColour(int, int, int) Sets the color of the pen used for drawing, based on the RGB values provided. public void SetColour(int red, int green, int blue) Parameters red int The red component of the pen color. green int The green component of the pen color. blue int The blue component of the pen color. Exceptions CanvasException Thrown if any RGB value is out of range (0-255). getBitmap() Returns the current bitmap of the canvas, representing the drawn content. public object getBitmap() Returns object The bitmap object representing the canvas.

api/WinFormsApp1.AppCommandFactory.html.title: Class AppCommandFactory | ASE Sadikshya Duwadi Comp-2 Documentation
api/WinFormsApp1.AppCommandFactory.html.keywords: Class AppCommandFactory Namespace WinFormsApp1 Assembly WinFormsApp1.dll public class AppCommandFactory : CommandFactory, ICommandFactory Inheritance object CommandFactory AppCommandFactory Implements ICommandFactory Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Constructors AppCommandFactory() Initializes a new instance of the AppCommandFactory class. This constructor does not take any parameters. public AppCommandFactory() Methods MakeCommand(string) Creates a command object based on the provided command type. It overrides the base class method to handle custom commands. If the command type is "write", an AppWrite command is created. If the command type is "pencolour", a PenColour command is created. If the command type is not recognized, the method calls the base class to handle it. public override ICommand MakeCommand(string commandType) Parameters commandType string The type of the command to be created (e.g., "write" or "pencolour"). Returns ICommand An instance of the appropriate ICommand for the given command type.

api/WinFormsApp1.AppWrite.html.title: Class AppWrite | ASE Sadikshya Duwadi Comp-2 Documentation
api/WinFormsApp1.AppWrite.html.keywords: Class AppWrite Namespace WinFormsApp1 Assembly WinFormsApp1.dll public class AppWrite : CommandOneParameter, ICommand Inheritance object Command CanvasCommand CommandOneParameter AppWrite Implements ICommand Inherited Members CommandOneParameter.param1 CommandOneParameter.param1unprocessed CanvasCommand.yPos CanvasCommand.xPos CanvasCommand.canvas CanvasCommand.Canvas Command.program Command.parameterList Command.parameters Command.paramsint Command.Set(StoredProgram, string) Command.Compile() Command.ProcessParameters(string) Command.ToString() Command.Program Command.Name Command.ParameterList Command.Parameters Command.Paramsint object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) Constructors AppWrite(AppCanvas) Initializes a new instance of the AppWrite class, which will execute a write operation on the specified canvas. public AppWrite(AppCanvas canvas) Parameters canvas AppCanvas The canvas where the text will be written. Fields text public string text Field Value string Methods CheckParameters(string[]) Checks and assigns the parameter for the write operation. The parameter should contain the text to be written on the canvas. public override void CheckParameters(string[] parameter) Parameters parameter string[] An array of parameters. The first element should be the text to write on the canvas. Execute() Executes the write operation by sending the text to be drawn on the canvas. public override void Execute()

api/WinFormsApp1.CanvasException.html.keywords: Class CanvasException Namespace WinFormsApp1 Assembly WinFormsApp1.dll Represents errors that occur within the canvas operations. This custom exception is thrown when there are issues with drawing or canvas manipulation. public class CanvasException : Exception, ISerializable Inheritance object Exception CanvasException Implements ISerializable Inherited Members Exception.GetBaseException() Exception.GetType() Exception.ToString() Exception.Data Exception.HelpLink Exception.HResult Exception.InnerException Exception.Message Exception.Source Exception.StackTrace Exception.TargetSite Exception.SerializeObjectState object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) Constructors CanvasException(string) Initializes a new instance of the CanvasException class with a specified error message. public CanvasException(string message) Parameters message string The error message that describes the cause of the exception.

api/WinFormsApp1.CommandFactory.html.keywords: Class CommandFactory Namespace WinFormsApp1 Assembly WinFormsApp1.dll public class CommandFactory : ICommandFactory Inheritance object CommandFactory Implements ICommandFactory Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Methods MakeCommand(string) Creates a command object based on the provided command type. This method checks the command type and returns the corresponding command object. If the command type is not recognized, it throws a FactoryException. public virtual ICommand MakeCommand(string commandType) Parameters commandType string The type of the command to be created (e.g., "moveto"). Returns ICommand An instance of the ICommand that matches the command type. Exceptions FactoryException Thrown when the provided command type is not found.

api/WinFormsApp1.PenColour.html.title: Class PenColour | ASE Sadikshya Duwadi Comp-2 Documentation
api/WinFormsApp1.PenColour.html.keywords: Class PenColour Namespace WinFormsApp1 Assembly WinFormsApp1.dll public class PenColour : CommandThreeParameters, ICommand Inheritance object Command CanvasCommand CommandOneParameter CommandTwoParameters CommandThreeParameters PenColour Implements ICommand Inherited Members CommandThreeParameters.param3 CommandThreeParameters.param3unprocessed CommandThreeParameters.CheckParameters(string[]) CommandTwoParameters.param2 CommandTwoParameters.param2unprocessed CommandOneParameter.param1 CommandOneParameter.param1unprocessed CanvasCommand.yPos CanvasCommand.xPos CanvasCommand.canvas CanvasCommand.Canvas Command.program Command.parameterList Command.parameters Command.paramsint Command.Set(StoredProgram, string) Command.Compile() Command.ProcessParameters(string) Command.ToString() Command.Program Command.Name Command.ParameterList Command.Parameters Command.Paramsint object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) Methods Execute() Executes the pen color change command by setting the pen color on the canvas. This method validates that three parameters (red, green, and blue values) are provided, checks if they are within the valid color range (0 to 255), and then updates the canvas pen color. public override void Execute() Exceptions CommandException Thrown when the number of parameters is incorrect or when the color values are out of range.

api/WinFormsApp1Test.Drawtest.html.title: Class Drawtest | ASE Sadikshya Duwadi Comp-2 Documentation
api/WinFormsApp1Test.Drawtest.html.keywords: Class Drawtest Namespace WinFormsApp1Test Assembly WinFormsApp1Test.dll [TestClass] public class Drawtest Inheritance object Drawtest Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Methods DrawTo_BelowCanvas_ThrowsCanvasException() Tests that the DrawTo method throws a CanvasException when attempting to draw below the canvas (with negative coordinates). This test ensures that drawing outside the valid canvas area triggers the correct exception. [TestMethod] public void DrawTo_BelowCanvas_ThrowsCanvasException() DrawTo_InsideOfTheCanvas_DrawsWithinTheBoundaryOfTheCanvas() Tests that the DrawTo method draws a line within the boundaries of the canvas when given valid coordinates. This test checks if the pixel color at the destination matches the expected color after drawing. [TestMethod] public void DrawTo_InsideOfTheCanvas_DrawsWithinTheBoundaryOfTheCanvas() DrawTo_OutsideTheBoundaryOfTheCanvas_ThrowsCanvasException() Tests that the DrawTo method throws a CanvasException when attempting to draw outside the boundaries of the canvas. This test checks if the appropriate exception message is returned when the coordinates are invalid. [TestMethod] public void DrawTo_OutsideTheBoundaryOfTheCanvas_ThrowsCanvasException()

api/WinFormsApp1Test.MoveTest.html.title: Class MoveTest | ASE Sadikshya Duwadi Comp-2 Documentation
api/WinFormsApp1Test.MoveTest.html.keywords: Class MoveTest Namespace WinFormsApp1Test Assembly WinFormsApp1Test.dll [TestClass] public class MoveTest Inheritance object MoveTest Inherited Members object.Equals(object) object.Equals(object, object) object.GetHashCode() object.GetType() object.MemberwiseClone() object.ReferenceEquals(object, object) object.ToString() Methods MoveTo_BelowCanvas_ThrowsCanvasException() Tests that the MoveTo method throws a CanvasException when trying to move below the canvas (negative coordinates). This test ensures that invalid movements below the canvas trigger the correct exception. [TestMethod] public void MoveTo_BelowCanvas_ThrowsCanvasException() MoveTo_InsideOfTheCanvas_MovesWithinTheBoundaryOfTheCanvas() Tests that the MoveTo method correctly moves the position within the boundaries of the canvas. This method verifies that the X and Y positions are updated to the new valid coordinates. [TestMethod] public void MoveTo_InsideOfTheCanvas_MovesWithinTheBoundaryOfTheCanvas() MoveTo_OutsideTheBoundaryOfTheCanvas_ThrowsCanvasException() Tests that the MoveTo method throws a CanvasException when trying to move outside the boundaries of the canvas. This test checks if the method properly handles invalid coordinates beyond the canvas size. [TestMethod] public void MoveTo_OutsideTheBoundaryOfTheCanvas_ThrowsCanvasException()
